plugins.name: Project Setter by UX Mate

Users can effortlessly define the font and size for the primary heading (H1), and the plugin automatically generates a comprehensive set of text styles required to kickstart any design project. By automating this aspect of the design workflow, the plugin not only saves valuable time but also ensures consistency across different text elements. Elevate your design process with this time-saving and user-friendly tool.

plugins.name: IconAutomation
plugins.description:
### **Comprehensive Guide to the IconAutomation Figma Plugin**


#### **Introduction**


**IconAutomation** is a powerful tool designed to streamline and automate the process of publishing icons within Figma. By integrating with GitLab CI, this plugin ensures your icon sets are always up-to-date and consistent across all platforms. Whether you're a designer working on a small project or part of a large team managing complex design systems, IconAutomation saves time and effort while eliminating manual workflows.


This plugin is primarily tailored for enterprise scenarios. Our company aims to build an internal icon library using Figma and GitLab as a replacement for Iconfont, which suffers from the following limitations:


- **Management Complexity**: Managing Iconfont requires multiple accounts and frequent importing/exporting between design files, Iconfont platforms, and code repositories.

- **Icon Accumulation**: Over time, unused icons accumulate and are loaded all at once in projects, preventing on-demand loading.

- **Font-Based Limitations**: Font-based icons may render blurry or pixelated on high-resolution screens.

- **Icon Conflicts**: Conflicts can arise when using multiple Iconfont libraries, leading to incorrect icon displays.


IconAutomation addresses these issues by leveraging SVGs to build a scalable internal icon library. Once configured, updating both the icon library and code repository can be done with a single click. Unlike font-based solutions, SVGs enable granular control over icon usage—only the icons actually used in a project are bundled, preventing unnecessary bloat.


#### **Core Features**


- **One-Click Publishing**: Publish icons directly from Figma with a single action.

- **GitLab Integration**: Seamlessly connect with GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated workflows.

- **Version Control**: Automatically manage semantic versioning in `package.json`.

- **Diff Generation**: Compare current and historical icons to generate detailed change reports.

- **Branch Automation**: Create feature branches, submit merge requests (MRs), and clean up temporary branches automatically.

- **SVG Optimization**: Optimize icon assets for performance using industry-standard tools.


#### **Prerequisites**


- **GitLab Instance**: A deployed GitLab instance (cloud-based or self-hosted).

- **Template Repository**: Deploy the `react-icons` template repository to your GitLab instance.

- **Figma Client**: Install the IconAutomation plugin via Figma's Community portal.

- **Plugin Configuration**: Configure essential settings as outlined below.


#### **Configuration Guide**


##### **GitLab Settings**


- **Domain**: The URL of your GitLab instance (e.g., `https://gitlab.com`).

- **Project ID**: Found under your repository’s **Settings > General**.

- **Access Token**: Generate a token with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes from GitLab’s **Profile > Access Tokens**.


##### **Figma Plugin Setup**


1. Install the plugin and grant necessary permissions.

2. Navigate to the plugin settings and input your GitLab domain, project ID, and access token.

3. Validate the connection to ensure seamless integration.


#### **Design Specifications**


##### **Page Naming Conventions**


- Pages intended for publishing **must** include the keyword "icon" (e.g., `product-icons`, `system-icons`).

- Only frames under these pages will be processed by the plugin.


##### **Frame Requirements**


- Frames must be named with one of the following suffixes:

- **Outlined**: For icons with stroke-based designs (e.g., `Navigation-Outlined`).

- **Filled**: For solid-filled icons (e.g., `Actions-Filled`).

- **Colored**: For multi-color icons, further categorized as:

- **Light**: Optimized for light backgrounds.

- **Dark**: Optimized for dark backgrounds.


##### **Icon Layer Rules**


- All icons **must** be Figma components (not frames or groups).

- Verify component status by selecting a layer—the top panel should display "Component."


##### **Naming Standards**


- Use **Upper Camel Case** (e.g., `AlertCircle`, `SettingsGear`).

- Append style suffixes (e.g., `AlertCircleOutlined`, `SettingsGearFilled`).

- Avoid special characters (`-`, `_`, spaces) and numeric suffixes unless intrinsic to the icon’s name (e.g., `Star1` is allowed; `Star 1` is invalid).

- Ensure uniqueness within each category to prevent conflicts.


#### **Automated Workflow**


1. **Repository Setup**: Configure GitLab details in the plugin settings.

2. **Local Validation**:

- The plugin checks for naming compliance, duplicates, and structural errors.

- Invalid icons are flagged with actionable feedback.

3. **Branch Management**:

- A temporary branch (e.g., `figma-update-20231001`) is created from `master`.

- Semantic versioning updates `package.json` (e.g., `1.2.0` → `1.3.0` for minor changes).

4. **Diff Analysis**:

- Compares current icons against the latest `master` commit.

- Generates a report detailing additions, modifications, and deletions.

5. **Asset Export**:

- Exports SVGs via Figma’s API and organizes them into folders (e.g., `/outlined`, `/filled`).

- Applies SVGO optimizations to reduce file size.

6. **Merge Request (MR)**:

- Submits an MR with a standardized title (e.g., `[Figma]: add icons`).

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
plugins.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

plugins.name: Translate AI
plugins.description:
Translate AI empowers you to effortlessly translate content within your designs using the power of AI. Whether you need to translate entire frames, groups, or components, this plugin streamlines the process, enhancing your design workflow.


Features:

Bulk Translation: Translate all selected content at once, saving you time and effort.

Language Suggestions: Get up to three translation outcomes for better language accuracy.

Versatile Application: Works seamlessly with Frames, Groups, Components, and more.

Important Tips:

Avoid Overloading: Translating excessively large amounts of content at once may cause errors.

Font Selection: Always choose the appropriate font for the language you're translating into to ensure accurate rendering.

plugins.name: DESY
plugins.description:
DESY is your Figma companion, designed for seamless design workflow. It ensures design system compliance, exports clean CSS code, and suggests style guides for a cohesive brand identity.


Design System Compliance

Effortlessly integrate design with development by cross-checking elements against your style guide. Instantly identify and highlight deviations, streamlining design-to-development handoff.


Export CSS

Generate exportable CSS code based on your style library. Consolidate styles into a single stylesheet for consistent updates, simplifying design system edits with auto-generated CSS snippets.


Styleguide Suggestions

Receive intelligent style guide suggestions based on your design file. Enhance your library with curated elements, jumpstarting a well-organized and consistent brand identity.


Why Choose DESY

Enhance collaboration, boost efficiency, and elevate brand consistency with DESY – the ultimate Figma tool for design system management, CSS export, and style guide refinement.
plugins.tagline: Keep your designs, identify styling issues, and streamline the handoff process with DESY

plugins.name: Design Pulse
plugins.description:
Automatically check and maintain design consistency across your Figma files. This plugin helps you ensure that all elements follow your design system guidelines.


Key Features:

• Color Styles - Ensure colors are linked to styles

• Typography - Check text styles consistency

• Effects - Validate shadow and blur styles

• Spacing - Check auto-layout spacing variables

• Storke - Verify stroke style usage

• Corner Radius - Validate radius consistency


How to use:

1. Select any frame in your design

2. Click "Run Checker"

3. Review the results

4. Click on any item to inspect and fix inconsistencies


Perfect for:

✓ Design System Managers

✓ UI/UX Designers

✓ Design QA

✓ Team Leads


The plugin provides real-time feedback and makes it easy to maintain design consistency across your projects.
plugins.tagline: Keep your design system's heartbeat strong

plugins.name: Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️
plugins.description:
Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️


Inspect every variable by selecting any layer in your design. Variable Sherlock will get every used variable in the selection, organized by node and specify its:

  1. Variable name
  2. Property applied to
  3. Type of variable
  4. Value of variable
  5. Collection of variable
  6. Library the collection comes from


You can also filter and sort your results to get specific kinds of variables based on name, type, property, etc.


Notes

  1. It can take some time to inspect large selections. If this happens, try to select a smaller amount of layers.
  2. The shown value reflects the value of the variable in the active mode for the layer it is connected to.
  3. Library names can only be shown if the library is imported to the file the plugin is running in. Otherwise, the library name will be left blank.


I'm always trying to improve the plugin. If this was useful for you have any suggestions or find any bug, don't hesitate to send me a message or buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Rodrigo Díaz Salvadores
accepted.description: Product Desig Engineer living in Stockholm

plugins.tagline: Inspect used variables in your design: name, type, value, collection & library

plugins.name: Variable Agent
plugins.description:
Variable Agent

The plugin is designed to facilitate the management of variable collections within Figma. At the moment, it allows users to copy and paste variable collections, making it easier to manage design tokens and other variable data across different projects and files.


Current Capabilities

- View Variable Collections: Users can view all local variable collections available in Figma.

- Copy Collections: Users can select a variable collection and copy it to their clipboard.

- Paste Collections: Users can paste the copied variable collection into another document or project.


Steps to Use the Plugin in Figma

1. Open the Plugin: Launch the plugin from the Figma plugins menu.

2. View Collections: Upon opening, the plugin will automatically fetch and display all available variable collections.

4. Select a Collection: Use the dropdown menu to select the collection you wish to copy.

5. Copy the Collection: Click the "Copy Collection" button to copy the selected variable collection to your clipboard.

6. Paste the Collection: Navigate to the document where you want to paste the collection, launch the plugin, and click the "Paste Collection" button.

7. Check Status Messages: Monitor the status messages displayed in the plugin for feedback on your actions.


Limitations

- Draft file Support: If you copy a collection with multiple modes, and paste in a file in your draft, it won't work. This is because draft file only support 1 mode.


- Aliased variable collections: The plugin does not currently support pasting variable collections with aliased variables. Aliased variables are those that reference other collection. It will recognize the alias but will not be able to resolve the reference.

accepted.name: Raymond
accepted.description: Strategic Product Designer and Creator of Frames and Divs.

plugins.tagline: Copy and paste variable collection across files and projects

plugins.name: Frame move
plugins.description:
Save time and nerves by automating the organization of frames! This tool allows you to quickly select and transfer necessary elements to a separate page with just one click. Important frames will always be at hand and well-structured, ensuring convenience in work and allowing you to focus on creativity and innovation.


Mark the pages: To select the pages for movement, simply click on the button with the "pin" icon to add the [pin] tag to the required pages.


Organize them in one motion: After marking all necessary pages, click on the "Swap" button. This will automatically create a new page named "All Page [date][time]", containing all the previously marked pages with the [pin] tag
plugins.tagline: Simplify project management: fast migration and perfect organization of frames.

plugins.name: Coordinate
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for quickly targeting nodes and extracting key positional data (X, Y, width, height) for use in other applications.


_Built using [The DataFace's Figma plugin template](https://github.com/the-dataface/figma-plugin-svelte-vite)_


How-to


1. Prefix desired nodes with a uniform string (e.g. `COORDINATE.` or `#` or `@`).

2. Once the plugin is initialized, enter that string in the search box (the default is `COORDINATE`) and run the command.

3. The positional data will show up below in the plugin's UI as JSON. You can download the results directly using the download button in the top-right corner of the results box.

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Extract coordinates from targeted nodes

plugins.name: Quick Roblox UI Exporter by Solys
plugins.description:
How it Works:

  1. Name the files inside Figma you want to export as one of the keywords: 'Frame' , 'Button', 'Icon', etc
  2. Preferably use a 1920x1080 background behind your UI, for example have the settings frame UI on a 1920x1080 background, group it together and name it 'Settings'
  3. The plugin will export and auto organize, you'll receive a file with Settings screen inside, an import reference for the Settings screen and all assets needed inside. Saving you hours on big projects as you can select 20, 30 screens at once and click export!


Why You’ll Love It:


⚡ One-Click Export – Select the UI screens you want to export and click the button


📁 Neatly Organized – Auto-sorts files by screens for easy access, all stored nicely in a zipped folder


⏳ Saves Time – Focus on design, not file management & exporting


✅ Hassle-Free – Works seamlessly with any project, automatically detects UI it needs to export by it's name, if it contains following keywords in it's name the plugin will automatically export the UI as a PNG file:

Frame

Button

Icon

UI

Scroll

Line

Title

Subtitle

Captions don't matter just include the keyword into one of those UIs you made and it'll export it automatically, you also have it nicely named for easy work with importing.


🔍 Auto-Upscaled (3x) – Maintains perfect quality for Roblox imports.


📌 Import References – Each screen automatically gets an import image reference to guide the user for seamless Roblox importing.



🎯 Try it now & simplify your workflow!

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent


Note: Make sure your text layers have the desired properties before creating styles, as these will be preserved in the created style.

accepted.name: Kiwi
accepted.description: Designer who codes

plugins.tagline: Create local text styles, preserving variable bindings and auto-applying to matching layers.

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720°) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.

accepted.name: Saranomy
accepted.description: I make premium Figma Plugins

plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

Revolutionize your Figma workflow with Layer Renaming, the ultimate solution for efficient layer organization. This powerful plugin offers:

plugins.name: African Name Generator
plugins.description:
African Name Generator Plugin


What It Does

The African Name Generator plugin helps you quickly add authentic African names to your designs. You can generate and insert first names, last names, or full names from Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, and Ethiopia.


How to Use It

1. Open the Plugin: Find and launch the African Name Generator plugin in your Figma plugins menu.

2. Select Parameters:

- Country: Choose Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, Ethiopia, Egypt, Senegal, Uganda, Tanzania, Morocco, and Cameroon.

- Gender: Pick male or female.

- Name Type: Select first name, last name, or full name.

3. Generate Name: Click the "Generate Name" button. The name will appear in the plugin.

4. Insert Name:

- Select a text layer in your Figma file.

- Click the "Insert Name" button. The plugin will insert the name into the selected text layer.


Limitations

- Name List: The names come from a fixed list. Not every African name is included.

- Font Support: The plugin uses fonts available in Figma. Ensure the desired font is available.

- Single Text Layer: Insert names into one text layer at a time. Repeat the process for multiple layers.


The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.

accepted.name: Joseph Kalu
accepted.description: I am a fintech and crypto product designer

plugins.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

plugins.name: Wireframeit Plugin

Transform live websites and HTML into fully editable designs or low-fidelity wireframes. Wireframeit accurately captures the layout, typography, and structure of any site and converts it into editable design files ready to export directly to Figma.


Use the browser extension to scan a live website, export it as a .wfit file, and import it into Figma using this plugin. You'll get clean frames, layout structure, and text boxes, no screenshots, no messy code.


How to use it:

  1. Install the Wireframeit browser extension.
  2. Click the extension on any website → Export → Figma.
  3. Download the .wfit file.
  4. Open Figma → run the Wireframeit plugin.
  5. Drag in the file, hit Import, and start editing.

plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

plugins.name: Layer Manager
plugins.description:
Layer Manager is designed to improve your workflow by providing quick access to important layer management functions. 


This plugin focuses on three primary operations: listing layers, controlling layer visibility, and renaming layers. 


Getting Started

  1. Open your Figma design file.
  2. Select the layers or frames you want to manage.
  3. Search for the Layer Manager plugin from the Figma plugin menu.
  4. Launch the plugin. 


Basic Operations

Viewing Layers:

After launching the plugin with your desired layers or frames selected, you'll see a list of all the layers within your selection.


Toggling Layer Visibility

Individual Layers:

  1. Find the layer you want to toggle in the list.
  2. Click the visibility icon next to the layer name to show or hide it.
  3. The change will be immediately reflected in your Figma design.

All Layers:

  1. Use the "Hide all" button to hide all layers in the list at once.
  2. Use the "Show all" button to make all layers in the list visible.


Renaming Layers:

  1. Locate the layer you want to rename in the list.
  2. Click on the layer name to enter edit mode.
  3. Type the new name for the layer.
  4. Press Enter or click outside the input field to confirm the new name.


Refreshing the Layer List:

If you make changes to your selection in the Figma file while the plugin is open:

  1. Click the "Refresh layers" button in the plugin interface.
  2. The layer list will update to reflect your current selection in the Figma document.


Searching Layers:

  1. Click on the search bar at the top of the layer list in the plugin interface and type in your search term. This could be: a layer name or a layer type (e.g., "rectangle," "text," or "group").
  2. As you type, the layer list would dynamically update to show only the layers that match your search criteria.
  3. To clear the search and see all layers again, simply delete your search term.


Tips for Efficient Use

  1. Start with a focused selection in your Figma file to manage specific groups of layers more effectively.
  2. Use the bulk hide/show actions to quickly toggle visibility for comparing different versions of your design.
  3. Regularly refresh the layer list if you're making changes in your Figma file while the plugin is open.
  4. Rename layers directly from the plugin to maintain consistent naming conventions without switching contexts.

accepted.name: Soliudeen Ogunsola
accepted.description: Product Designer.

plugins.tagline: A better way to view, hide, and rename your design layers.

Introducing Translate Pro for Figma! Seamlessly translate text layers within your Figma projects to over 130 languages.


Translate Pro helps ensure your designs resonate across different languages and cultures. Enhance your design workflow with our integrated translation solution, simplifying cross-lingual communication and design adaptation like never before.
89386.tagline: The ultimate translation plugin for your needs

plugins.name: Mattarello - Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
🛠 Imagine your design process as a bustling marketplace, where ideas are traded, and creativity flows like the spices in a bazaar. In this vibrant scene, your designs are like unique ingredients, ready to be mixed into the grand recipe of your project. But transferring these ingredients from the market stall (Figma) to your cooking station (GitHub or other servers) can often feel like navigating through a crowded square, balancing pots and pans filled with precious spices.


🔌 Introducing Mattarello, the magic carpet that effortlessly carries your Figma variables across the digital divide in a swift, seamless flight. This Figma plugin is your culinary assistant, meticulously organizing your spices (design tokens) into neat jars (JSON format), ready to be shelved directly into your pantry (GitHub or other servers), automating your workflow as if by magic.


👨‍🍳 Embrace the future of design-cooking with our plugin, and let your creative dishes be seasoned to perfection with the efficiency and harmony of automated spice delivery. Your design kitchen will never be the same, as you find more time to taste, experiment, and refine your creations to Michelin-star standards.


—————


💬 If you notice anything that doesn't seem accurate or could be improved, please reach out to me — I'd be delighted to have a conversation about it.


—————


With love and coffee, kkratter ❤️

accepted.name: kkratter
accepted.description: Product & Design System Designer

plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma to Github

plugins.name: Duckster: Text Styles Scanner
plugins.description:
Perfect for maintaining design consistency and quickly identifying font variations 👌


How it works

  1. Select multiple elements you want to scan.
  2. Run the plugin and click "Analyze".
  3. Instantly view all text styles used within the selected area.
  4. Click on any style to highlight all layers where it appears.


I’d love to hear your feedback and suggestions for improvement.

Wish you organized layouts and clean code! ✨

accepted.name: Anastasiya Tereschenko
accepted.description: Senior Design systems designer, UI/UX

plugins.tagline: Instantly view all text styles used within the selected area

plugins.name: Biny.tech Banner Generator
plugins.description:
Biny.tech Banner Generator is your ultimate tool for creating high-quality banners in Figma. This plugin empowers designers and marketers to swiftly generate banners with customizable aspect ratios and standard sizes tailored to various platforms.


// Explainer video >> https://vimeo.com/1019971678 <<


Easily add and manage your aspect ratios and apply template. The plugin also allows you to save and load sets of aspect ratios for different clients, making it ideal for anyone who manages multiple projects or brands.


Transform your banner creation process with Biny.tech Banner Generator and achieve consistency and efficiency in every project.

accepted.name: Tommie M.
accepted.description: Motion Designer & Developer

plugins.tagline: Quickly create and customize banners with flexible templates and aspect ratios.

plugins.name: Color Picker Pro
plugins.description:
Color wheel hue with a central triangle that splits chroma into shades and tints.


Sliders that offer consitent orthogonal saturation and lightness across colors.


Precise color selection by comparison with previously set color.
plugins.tagline: Your colors, perfected. Simple. Elegant. Pro.
